creator: brari01@netzero.net
text:
Windows 2003 server, after applying SP1 and 6/14/2005 security patches.  All 
Apache httpd servers fail to start; were ok before the update.  Many errorlog 
msgs over and over:
[Wed Jun 22 08:53:46 2005] [warn] (22)Invalid argument: select failed with 
errno 10038
.......
[Wed Jun 22 08:53:46 2005] [warn] (22)Invalid argument: select failed with 
errno 10038
[Wed Jun 22 08:53:46 2005] [error] Too many errors in select loop. Child 
process exiting.

I shouldn't say the servers fail to start.  They run, taking all available CPU 
time, apparently in a loop restarting the listening processes.  The servers 
fail to work; they cannot be connect to with a browser.
creator: brari01@netzero.net
brari01@netzero.net
text:
I have found this to be caused by the presence of MS proxy client being 
installed.  Since removing this, the servers are now working with SP1.

creator: andrewp@pcinternetpatrol.com
text:
First of all, sorry for my English :).
So,
MS proxy client not installed on my machine, but i have this bug.
And i think that problem not with MS Proxy, but with different(not winsock)
network provider.
